page.title: 15Law and Order in Nibley.
page.content: Using patrol vehicles and now a bike, the police find no real problems in this area.It is a peaceful community. The constable on the bike stops and talks to the villagers and usually ends up with a bundle of rhubarb! Two problems are the parking outside the pub,the Black Horse,and speeding through Woodmancote on the A4135.The sheer volume of the traffic and the number of junctions add to the danger of accidents.Visits are made to the Golf Course to check for vandalism and visits are made to people's homes for enquiries.One officer visits the local school to give courses on road safety and at primary schools there are cycling proficiency courses including a test.There is also an advanced course to follow it up.
